artist: Attributed to Ventura Salimbeni; Formerly attributed to Francesco Vanni
description: sketchy figures; compositional lines (large X and horizontal line) drawn over image; collapsing woman in LRQ, supported by standing figure; woman has PR arm outstretched to standing saint, who holds out PR hand to her; other standing and kneeling figures
marks:
Inscriptions and Stamps

bottom center, in brown
medium: Black chalk, pen and brown ink and brown wash; partially squared, with perspectival indications; laid down, in window mount
provenance: Unidentified collector, Lugt 2898, probably English, 17th century. Nicholas Lanier, Lugt 2885 (1588-1666), London; 'William Gibson, cf. Lugt 2885 (d. 1703), London. unidentified collector, Lugt 2736, 'Dutch (before 1765). Nathaniel Hone, Lugt 2793 (1718-1784) London. Sale, Christie's, London, July 4, 2000, no. 92, for Â£6,463, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (2000-d.2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Bishop Saint Exorcising Demons from a Woman
